item.title: First-person puzzle game Chroma Zero now available for PS5
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Previously released for PC.

Evan Korzon has release first-person puzzle game Chroma Zero for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store for $9.99, the developer announced.

Chroma Zero first launched for PC via Steam on December 12, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Evan Korzon:

About

Explore a unique and connected world. Understand its fragile balance, uncover its deepest questions, and find more than just the answers.

Chroma Zero immerses you in a universe of mystery, color, energy, and movement, and challenges your expectations and intuition. There are no levels, the puzzles are integrated into the fabric of the space itself, and everything can change in the blink of an eye. Exploration and curiosity are rewarded.

Gameplay

Playtesters have taken between six and 12 hours to finish the game, and a bit more to explore everything. Most progress is gated only by knowledge, which is gained by exploring and experimenting.

This is an immersive, non-linear, risk-taking and moderately challenging game, made by a solo developer. The narrative is mostly light-hearted, but can be impactful at times. The puzzles ramp up in difficulty, though the game helps to guide you as well. So if you’re exploring everywhere, you will know what to do—maybe just not how to do it! I was inspired by games like Antichamber, Outer Wilds, Myst / Riven, and the discovery elements of Tunic. I hope to bring more games like these into the world, since by their nature they are focused on giving you a wonderful and surprising first-playthrough.

Key Features

  • Knowledge Based Progression – Learn the rules of the space, and you can progress farther in the world and deeper into the mystery
  • Open-World Puzzles – Explore everywhere, the world itself is the puzzle. There are no levels.
  • Extremely Dynamic Environment – The world reacts to your actions in dramatic fashion.
  • Original Score – An enchanting and beautiful Original Score by Adam Kromelow and Dan Rufolo.
  • Narrative – Narrative with charm and wit, and at times, wit and charm.

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation 5 Launch Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/first-person-puzzle-game-chroma-zero-now-available-for-ps5

item.title: Code Vein II character trailer – Holly Asturias
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

A healer burdened by sin.

Bandai Namco has released a new trailer for Code Vein II introducing character Holly Asturias.

Lyle McLeish is “a healer burdened by sin.” Her quote reads, “I don’t think I’ll ever find it in my heart to forgive him… But I’m also not letting him die…”

Code Vein II is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on January 30, 2026.

Watch the trailer below.

Character Trailer: Holly Asturias

English

Japanese



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/code-vein-ii-character-trailer-holly-asturias

item.title: Lost Skies coming to PS5, Xbox Series in Q1 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for PC.

Publisher Humble Games and developer Bossa Games will release open-world cooperative survival adventure game Lost Skies for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series in Q1 2026, the companies announced.

Lost Skies first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on April 18, followed by a full release on September 17.

Here is an overview of the game, via Humble Games:

About

Lost Skies is a cooperative survival adventure for one-to-six players set amongst the clouds, in a vast sky of floating islands. Find and craft ancient technology, build your own skyship, brave ferocious storms, and battle giant threats that await beyond the horizon.

Explore an Ancient World of Danger and Beauty

Embark on an adventure through the remnants of ancient civilizations. Uncover the mystery of their downfall and employ their advanced technology to aid your journey. Navigate a shattered world ravaged by storms, revel in lands reclaimed by nature, and face the colossal beings still roaming the skies that brought about humanity’s destruction.

Experience Unparalleled Freedom

Flow effortlessly through the skies’ broken landscapes with a physics-based grappling hook. Climb, glide, and fly as you use your own creativity for both traversal and dynamic combat. Enter a seamless world where you are free to travel to any landmark you can see on the horizon.

Shape Your Skyship

With a vast world to explore, you’ll need to build your own skyship to navigate the open skies. Lost Skies‘ unique ship crafting system allows you to intricately shape your ship’s hull, and freely place parts where you want, taking care to consider the quality and weight of the materials you use. Not only is your skyship your home in the clouds, it is also your warship to take into battle and survive treacherous weather.

Key Features

  • Adventure across a massive open world of unique, hand-crafted floating islands, with daunting weather walls dividing the sky into regions, each with their own visuals, resources, and wildlife to discover.
  • Play solo or with up to six players on player-hosted servers, and experience an ever-expanding world as Bossa Games and the community continuously add more islands to the game.
  • Every island is filled with combat, discovery, and puzzling ancient technology for you to decipher, driving your exploration as you obtain loot and unlock paths to delve deeper into the islands where further mysteries await. Contend with both curious and hostile wildlife that has taken over the world in the absence of humans.
  • Get inventive with an intricate ship-building system that allows you to shape every facet of your skyship. The underlying physics engine means weight and aerodynamics play an important role in your designs. Build up a single ship for yourself or your crew of friends over the course of your adventure, or each build your own ship as part of a fleet.
  • Enjoy a survival experience with no need for constant eating and drinking to stay alive. With beautiful views of the cloudscape and a serene soundtrack, there is always room for some down time to take in the sights or build in peace.
  • Your grappling hook, glider, climbing ability, and more mobility options give you the freedom to explore the islands as you wish, taking full advantage of the game’s setting among the clouds. Uncover hidden underside caverns, swing to the top of the tallest spire—nowhere is off limits
  • A flexible crafting system considers material weight and properties to impact the stats and physical attributes of crafted items. Balance your ship and equipment with the right materials to maximize their performance.
  • Engage in epic naval-style boss fights. Take your skyship into tense battles and exchange cannon fire with the giant ancient beings responsible for the end of humanity. Each one will test the skills and technology you have accumulated so far, and hold the keys to travelling to the farthest corners of the world.

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/lost-skies-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-in-q1-2026

item.title: Wuthering Waves version 3.0 update ‘We Who See the Stars’ launches December 25
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

A blend of mechanical science-fiction and space romance.

Kuro Games will release the version 3.0 update for free-to-play open-world action RPG Wuthering Waves, dubbed “We Who See the Stars,” on December 25, the developer announced.

Here is an overview of the update:

Version 3.0 Overview

  • New Main Quests
    • Chapter III Act I: What Burns Beneath Frostlands
    • Chapter III Act II: Ode to the Second Sunrise
  • Let’s Go, to Startorch Academy!
    • Log in to claim Radiant Tide x10 and Crystal Solvent x10 via in-game mail.
  • New Utility
    • Expedition Motorbike
  • New Areas
  • Optimizations
    • Main Quest Fast Track Event – After Version 3.0 goes live, head to the Resonance Nexus In Jinzhou during Main Quest Chapter I Act I “First Resonance” and log in to the Terminal to unlock Next Stop: Lahal-Rol (Main Quest Fast Track Event); you can go to Lahai-Roi directly and start experiencing the Version 3.0 content. This event will be available alongside Next Stop: Rinascita (another Main Quest Fast Track Event).
    • Upgrade Functions – Raised the Data Bank’s max level to 30; after upgrading the Data Bank, COST1 (Common) and COST3 (Elite) Echoes will also receive enhanced drop rate counts. The double-drop event can now stack with the Purification & Separation system, which gives you the option of choosing to claim double rewards during the event period; If you have more than two double-drop claims remaining, you will consume two claims to receive four times the rewards, and if you only have one claim left, you will consume 1 claim to receive triple rewards.
    • World Exploration – In Version 3.0, better visual details and ambient sound details on PC mesh with Lahai-Roi’s unique terrain to present an immersive gaming experience.
    • Experience on Mobile – After downloading Basic Resources and entering the game on mobile, you can continue downloading remaining resources on the settings menu. It also supports download-while-playing, and resources are categorized by area and storyline. A new “Resource Cleanup” function will be available on mobile. Once certain cutscenes have been completed, as your current story progresses, you can use the “Manage Game Assets” options in Settings to clean up unnecessary files to help save storage space. Frame Generation support will be extended to include mobile devices equipped with Dimensity 9400, Dimensity 9400+, or Snapdragon 8 Gen 5.
    • Interface – Added dynamic visuals to the lineup interface; added visual markers to the event interface for easier navigation.
  • New Resonators
    • Lynae
    • Mornye
  • Upcoming Featured Resonator Convene
    • Phase I
      • Undefined Spectrum (New!)
      • Dance in the Storm’s Wake
      • Through Verses and Rhythms
    • Phase II
      • Distant May the Starlights Be (New!)
      • Eternal Radiance on the Crown
      • Across Time’s Waxes and Wanes
  • New Weapons
    • Spectrum Blaster
    • Starfield Calibrator
    • Synth Armament Series
  • Upcoming Featured Weapon Convene
    • Phase I
      • Spectrum Blaster (New!)
      • Defier’s Thorn
      • Woodland Aria
    • Phase II
      • Starfield Calibrator (New!)
      • Thunderflare Dominion
      • Moongazer’s Sigil
  • Special Events
    • Lahai-Roi Pioneers – Area Exploration Event
    • Capturing Starlight – Photo Collection Event
    • Gifts of Freshers Week – 7-Day Login Event
    • Beyond the Waves: Lahai-Roi – Featured Exploration Event
    • Peaks of Prestige: Rekindled Duel – Echo Combat Event
    • Signs of a Silent Star – Leisure Event
    • Startorch Racing – Leisure Event
    • Back to Solaris – Web Event
    • Persona Sonic – Collaboration Event
  • New Echoes
    • Hyvatia
    • Reactor Husk
    • Twin Nova: Nebulous Cannon
    • Twin Nova: Collapsar Blade
    • Flora Reindeer
    • Mining Reindeer
    • Ironhoof
    • Spacetrek Explorer
    • Sabercat Reaver
    • Sabercat Prowler
    • Frostbite Coleald
    • Windlash Coleoid
    • Flora Drone
    • Mining Drone
    • Geospider 54
    • Zip Zap
    • Tremor Warrior
  • New Sonata Effects
    • Pact of Neonlight Leap
    • Halo of Starry Radiance
    • Rite of Gilded Revelation
  • New Phantom Echoes
    • Phantom Twin Nova: Nebulous Cannon
    • Phantom Twin Nova: Collapsar Blade
    • Phantom: Chop Chop
  • New High Difficulty Recurring Challenge
    • Doubled Pawns Matrix: Pilot
  • New Permanent Event
    • Operation: Frontier Renewal
  • New Tactical Hologram Challenge
    • Tactical Hologram: Dreamless
  • Fan Creation Program
    • Solaris Supercup Series
  • Merchandise
    • Phoebe 1/7 Scale Figure Prototype Reveal – More updates / information coming soon.

Wuthering Waves is available now for PlayStation 5, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play. The PC version will also be available via Steam starting April 29.

Watch a new set of trailers below.
